meanings.definition: To treat or combine with a halogen.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will halogenate the water to study its properties.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often halogenate organic compounds to alter their characteristics.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally halogenated my sandwich with too much salt, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to halogenate the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to halogenate the colors in the painting, creating a vibrant effect.

meanings.definition: To undergo a reaction with a halogen.
meanings.sent1: The metal will halogenate when exposed to chlorine gas.
meanings.sent2: Certain plastics halogenate easily when in contact with fluorine.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to halogenate as soon as the baking powder was added.
meanings.sent4: His ideas halogenated in the heated debate, transforming into something new.
meanings.sent5: The forest air seemed to halogenate with the scent of pine after the rain.

meanings.definition: To introduce a halogen into a compound.
meanings.sent1: The chemist will halogenate the molecule by adding chlorine atoms.
meanings.sent2: It is important to carefully halogenate the solution to avoid unwanted side reactions.
meanings.sent3: The potion recipe called for the wizard to halogenate the mixture with a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent4: The new ingredient seemed to halogenate the soup, giving it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight appeared to halogenate the colors of the flowers, making them appear more vibrant.
